column4: .. any1 know; why xubuntu is throttling down the CPU by fault livecd install??
s/fault/default
(and how to 'fix' it :))
the throttling is probably set to "on-demand" try doing something cpu intensive and you'll see you cpu throttle up to max.
tnx!.. how can i monitor the change, pls?
'apt-cache search xfce cpu frequency'
that will list a few applications avaiable for xfce and cpu throttling.
http://pastebin.com/QB4nsz77
xfce4-cpufreq-plugin looks like it's what you want
then you can add it to the panel to monitor cpufreq, it may also allow you to change the presets
im a complete noob.. so pls excuse me - but if i install it, it'll let me see/control?
it's a been a while since I was using xfce, working from memory
right click on the panel? Ummmm look for panel properties, or somesuch
again, tyvm, xfce4-cpufreq-plugin allowed me to set the frequency on max (with on demand, or whatever)
I spoke too soon :( It resets back to the values it showed on install: http://www.zimagez.com/zimage/screenshot-06102012-022251am.php
the governor settings aren't staying set?
neither of the two
moment, I'm going to search bugs
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xfce4-cpufreq-plugin/+bug/977942

in the xfce panel I can see it 'throttling' to 3.1GHz but idk if that's real... since changing the settings won't stick; & the benchmark report shows the wrong CPU names - nothing to do with my system: http://www.datafilehost.com/download-23228ba8.html
[..] as this has a severe impact on a non-core application. -- I can follow the WORKAROUND there, do you think?
there's a workaround listed on the bugs page. Looks like the bug has been pushed upstream but still no fix.
here's the CPU benchmark info, that's totally off & i will try the workaround.. http://paste.ubuntu.com/1032966/
